body:
Hi all,

This post is directed towards Rioters and the community.
Why is Fizz being reworked? He is currently in such a good spot. Fizz has a high skill cap - he isn't hard to pick up, but he is very hard to master. Me, and my fellow fizz mains (aka people who actually play the champion a lot AND understand how the game works at a high level) agree on the fact that Fizz, in his current state, does not need to be changed. Currently, Fizz is not played often in plat 1 and higher elos. There are only some one tricks who play Fizz, and they all agree that Fizz is in a good spot. Which prompts the question, why is this rework even happening? In fact, many Fizz onetricks (myself included) own multiple accounts, with Fizz as their most played champion. Do not mistake this for Fizz being a popular champion. 

Now I would like to discuss the changes. Firstly, you are removing the mark which shows the passive being active. Why? All it does is make it easier for people to see when their w gets ready to be cast again. To me, it feels like a completely unnecessary nerf. Second, you are removing the cooldown reduction when killing any unit with the W active. Currently, the only reason that Fizz is even REMOTELY strong, is that the w can be used in lane to last hit minions. The reason that this was implemented in the first place, was to make it easier to cs against hard ranged matchups! So why do you find to need to remove this mechanic from the game now? This change specifically will hard nerf Fizz's laning power. Lastly, it appears that the w is no longer an auto attack reset? In the video that I linked, the animation of w goes at the regular auto attack speed. If this is the case, it is another nerf. These are all nerfs; I don't think Fizz is op; so why nerf?

I see people on youtube already making videos about this mini rework. They all think that it is op - yet those people do not play Fizz. My fear is that you guys are going to nerf Fizz again, just because people are crying that Fizz is op. Please do not go through with this change. Fizz is already balanced, and is in a very good spot. I would really like it if you guys reached out to some Fizz players and ask them their opinions about these changes. I am always available to chat (you have my email), and I am sure than other Fizz players would be up for it as well. I hear that this is being tested in PBE - but as I am sure you all know, PBE is filled with noobs. They do not know what they are talking about. IF there is any way that 

Thanks for your time,

- Passionate Fizz Player

Obviously the current Fizz isn't bad, but many players wish for the old Fizz, like Season 2 Fizz, to return. The majority of Fizz players prefer the old W, so Riot is trying to create something similar but not the exact same. The reason why Fizz players testing on the PBE feel that this new W is bad is because Riot directly stated they made the numbers smaller than they should be, so they could tune them later. However, with some increased base damages and ratios, the new W will be much stronger than the original, because it allows Fizz to actually fight after using up all his abilities. 
Although Fizz is in a good state, he lacks the sustain/escapes of other assassins such as Zed or Leblanc. Many players tend to think that Fizz's E is his "get out of jail free" card, but it's on an 8 second cooldown late game, and Fizz needs it for damage. This way, with the new W, instead of dealing massive damage immediately, Fizz still deals decent damage and has something else to do while he waits for his other abilities to come up.
In addition, Fizz's new W gives him "more value"; by wanting to have the second part of the W, Fizz can now use maximum damage with the first part of his W without having to wait 2 seconds.
